titles.title: FAIR Act of 2015
Freeing Americans from Inequitable Requirements Act of 2015
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the individual health insurance mandate not apply until the employer health insurance mandate is enforced without exceptions.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
2/3/2015--Introduced. Freeing Americans from Inequitable Requirements Act of 2015 or the FAIR Act of 2015
Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the individual mandate to purchase health care coverage, to delay such requirement from taking effect until the Secretary of the Treasury submits to Congress a certification that the employer mandate to provide health care coverage for employees is being applied and administered without any administratively created exceptions.
